interdroid.swan.swansong

Interface ParseableEnum<E extends java.lang.Enum<E>>

  • Type Parameters:
    E -
    All Superinterfaces:
    Parseable<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinaryLogicOperator, Comparator, HistoryReductionMode, MathOperator, UnaryLogicOperator

    public interface ParseableEnum<E extends java.lang.Enum<E>>
extends Parseable<E>
    This class is designed to make enumerations safe to persist more easily while still allowing us to easily switch on enumerations and also ensures that we can get a string version and return from a string version of the enumeration for representation in expressions where the string doesn't have to match the name of the enumeration value. Enums which implement this should implement static parse and convert methods which returns the enum from the value for convenience. Unfortunately there is now way for interfaces to force a static method and all enumerations extend a single class. This is just a broken part of java enumerations. Fortunately this method is easy to write: public static E parse(String value) { return E.>VALUE<.parseString(value); } public static E convert(int value) { return E.>VALUE<.convertInt(value); } This encourages the avoidance of using ordinal() to convert an enum to an integer value since they can lead to problems if the enumeration adds valid values at a later date.
    Author:
    roelof <rkemp@cs.vu.nl>, nick <palmer@cs.vu.nl>
